properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 18 at 12:20PM EST until January 21 at 11:45AM EST by NWS Grand Rapids MI
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Grand Rapids has issued a

* Flood Advisory for...
An Ice Jam in...
West central Mecosta County in central Michigan...

* Until 1145 AM EST Tuesday.

* At 1151 AM EST, emergency management reported an ice jam behind
Rogers Dam on the Muskegon River near 11 Mile Road. Flooding may
develop between Big Rapids and the Rogers Dam Pond over the next
few days as colder weather settles in and the ice jam remains in
place. Some of the streets that could be affected by high water
and minor flooding are 183rd Avenue near 12 Mile Road, Riverside
Drive, and Maple Street. Homes at the lowest spots along the river
should pay close attention tonight into Sunday as colder
temperatures settle in further strengthening the ice jam.

* River levels near ice jams are very unpredictable, and can change
quickly with little or no warning.
properties.instruction:
Water levels around ice jams are notoriously unpredictable, and can
change quickly with little or no warning. Anyone living or recreating
near the river should pay close attention over the next few days and
prepare for additional changes in water levels.
